Imprint.Description: The Greenskins are a highly primitive and warlike race of bestial humanoid barbarians and raiders that occupy much of the Eastern Hemisphere of the Warhammer World. The term "Greenskins" is a common collective description used by many civilised nations to refer to the forces of the Orcs and Goblins and other biologically related races. The broadest division is between the Orcs, who are strong, brutish, and savage warriors, and the Goblins, who are smaller and weaker, but cunning and conniving creatures.\n\nThe Greenskins are considered by many to be the scourge of all civilisation. These tribal warriors are extremely violent, raiding ceaselessly, carrying war and barbarism to all corners of the known world. Time and again, hordes of Greenskins would arise without warning and lay a great swath of destruction that has no direction or purpose other than simple violence. Indeed, the Greenskin race's single motive is violence, an ever increasing mass of warfare that has the potential to dominate and cover the entire world in a seething green tide

Magic.Name: Spells of the Big Waaagh!
Magic.Enemy: Wood Elves, Lore of Athel Loren

Weapon.Name: WAAAGH! Cleava
Weapon.Description: All hits from this weapons wound automatically and allow no armour saves

Weapon.Name: Battleaxe of the Last WAAAGH!
Weapon.Rule: Attacks and Strength bonus equal rank bonus
Weapon.Description: The wielder of this weapon receives a bonus equal to his unit's rank bonus to both his Attacks and Strength - calculate this when the wielder makes his attacks

Weapon.Name: Basha's Bloodaxe
Weapon.Description: Grants +1 Strength in the first round of combat. The wielder of this weapon is subject to Frenzy (D6 extra attacks). The wielder can never lose his Frenzy

Weapon.Name: Shaga's Screamin' sword
Weapon.Rule: +1 Strength and +1 Attack for each enemy character within 12"
Weapon.Description: The wielder receives +1 Strength and +1 Attack for each enemy character within 12"

Arcane.Name: Skull wand of Kaloth
Arcane.Description: For each successful hit inflicted by this weapon, the victim must pass a Leadership test or be slain instantly. No armour, ward or regeneration saves are allowed against this special attack. If the tests are passed, roll to Wound and save as normal. Only for shamans

Weapon.Name: Porko's Pigstikka
Weapon.Rule: Additional attack for each pointt of rank bonus
Weapon.Description: Spear. On the turn the wielder charges, he receives an additional attack for each point of rank bonus that the unit hi is attacking has (up to a maximum of +3)

Weapon.Name: Ulag's Akrit axe
Weapon.Description: The wielder may re-roll any missed to hit rolls. It also grants +1 Strength in the first round of combat

Weapon.Name: Backstabber's blade
Weapon.Description: Grants poisoned attacks. Grants the wielder +1 Strength if he is attacking the enemy in the flank and +2 Strength if he is attacking them in the rear

Weapon.Name: Wollopa's One Hit Wunda
Weapon.Description: Once per game, this weapon grants the wielder Strength 10 for duration of the combat phase. One use only

Weapon.Name: Mortog's best Basha
Weapon.Description: The wielder of this blafe gains +1 Wepon Skill, +1 Strength and +1 Initiative

Weapon.Name: Sneaky Skewerer
Weapon.Description: Wounds caused by this weapon suffer an additional -3 armour save modifier

Weapon.Name: Lucky's Dirk
Weapon.Rule: +1 Strength for each enemy magic item
Weapon.Description: If the bearer strikes an enemy character carrying one or more magic item, his hits at +1 Strength for each magic item

Armour.Name: Armour of Gork
Armour.Description: Light armour. The wearer has +1 Toughness

Shield.Name: Spliteful shield
Shield.Rule: Strength 5 hit for each 1 on a enemy roll to Hit
Shield.Description: Shield. Any foe that rolls a 1 when attempting to strike the bearer in close combat suffers a Strength 5 hit for each such roll

Additional.Name: Effigy of Mork
Additional.Description: All close combat attacks made against the bearer suffer -1 to Hit

Additional.Name: Warboss Umm's Best Boss 'at
Additional.Description: Grants the rearer a 5+ Ward save

Additional.Name: Amulet of Protectyness
Additional.Rule: When the bearer of this amulet is wounded, he counts as having the save armour as the model that caused the wounds

Additional.Name: The Collar of Zorga
Additional.Rule: Steeds and monsters require Strength 6 to hit the bearer
Additional.Description: Steeds, monsters (ridden and unridden) and beasts pulling chariots require 6S to hit the bearer

Arcane.Name: Idol of Mork
Arcane.Rule: +1 Power dice for each Orc unit within 24"
-1 Power dice for each fleeing frendly unit within 24"
Arcane.Description: +1 Power dice for each Orc unit within 24"\n-1 Power dice for each fleeing frendly unit within 24"

Arcane.Name: Staff of Sneaky Stealin'
Arcane.Rule: Steals 1 Power dice from the enemy to dispel
Arcane.Description: At the start of each of your opponent's magic phases, you may take one dice from you opponent's power poll and add it to your dispel poll

Arcane.Name: Staff of Baduumm
Arcane.Description: Adds +1 to any casting attempts made by the bearer

Arcane.Name: WAAAGH! paints
Arcane.Rule: +2 to any casting attemts in close combat
Arcane.Description: If the Shaman is in combat at the start of the Orcs and Goblins magic phase, he receives +2 to any casting attempts

Arcane.Name: Magic mushrooms
Arcane.Rule: +D6 to casting roll, one use only
Arcane.Description: +D6 to casting roll, one use only. If Mushroom dice is an 1 then the spell is miscast

Weapon.Name: The Horn of Urgok
Weapon.Rule: Bound item, Power Level 5, +1 Leadership for all friendly units, -1 Leadership for all enemy units
Weapon.Description: Bound item, Power Level 5. +1 Leadership for all friendly units, -1 Leadership for all enemy units. Roll a D6 after each use. On the roll of a 1, the bearer suffer a Strength 5 hit with no armour save allowed

Weapon.Name: The Pipes of Doom
Weapon.Rule: Panic test for enemy cavalry, one use only
Weapon.Description: The pipes can be played at the start of the shooting phase. Each enemy cavalry unit, monster (ridden or unridden) and chariot within 24" must take a Panic test

Weapon.Name: Ironback Boar
Weapon.Description: Boar. When charging, this steed does D3 Strength 5 impact hits in addition to its norman attack

Weapon.Name: Warboss Imbad's iron gnashas
Weapon.Description: The character wearing the Gnashas gains the Killing Blow special ability in close combat. Chomp!

Weapon.Name: Bigged's Kickin' boots
Weapon.Description: Grants the wearer +1 Atack on his profile

Weapon.Name: Maad's map
Weapon.Description: Before deploymnet begins roll a D6. On 2-6 the bearer of the map may be deployed as a scout. On a roll of a 1, he got lost and must be deployed as normal

Additional.Name: Brimstone bauble
Additional.Rule: D6 Strength 6 hits when bearer is slain
Additional.Description: When bearer is slain, all units (friend or foe) in base contact suffer D6 Strength 6 hits, distributed as for shooting

Additional.Name: Nibbla's Titty ring
Additional.Description: Bound spell 'Eadbutt Power Level 3. Roll a D6 after each use. On the roll of a 1, the bearer suffers a Strength 5 hit with no armour saves allowed

Weapon.Name: Mad Cap mushrooms
Weapon.Rule: Fanatics may re-roll the number of Hits caused

Additional.Name: Guzzla's Battle Brew
Additional.Description:
The character with the brew is assumed to have 'bolstered' himself before battle - roll a dice and consult the following table to determine the effects upon the drinker:
1-2 - Subject to Stupidity for remainder of the game
3-4 - Hatred of all enemies for the remainder of the game
5-6 - Hatred of all enemies and Frenzy for the remainder of the game

Banner.Name: Mork's Spirit-Totem
Banner.Rule: Adds a number of dispel dice equal rank bonus
Banner.Description: This magical banner adds a number of dispel dice to the pool equal to the unit's rank bonus

Banner.Name: Rowdy Grott's Big Red Raggedy Banner
Banner.Rule: All Goblins within 12" may re-roll Panic test
Banner.Description: All Goblins within 12" of the banner may re-roll failed Panic test

Banner.Name: Bad Moon on a stick
Banner.Description: All Night Goblin in this unit are Stubborn

Banner.Name: The Spider banner
Banner.Description: All Goblin in the unit have poisoned attacks (shooting and combat)

Banner.Name: Gork's WAAAGH! banner
Banner.Rule: D6" to charge move, only one use
Banner.Description: The unit adds D6" to its charge move. Declare charges first and then roll

Banner.Name: Nogg's banner of Buthery
Banner.Description: All model in the unit have +1 Attack in the turn the banner is used. In the case of mounted models, only the rider gets the bonus, not the mount

Lord.Name: Gorbad Ironclaw
Lord.Description: Gorbad Ironclaw is one of the most infamous of all Orc Warbosses. In his day, Gorbad led a massive invasion that almost crushed the Empire. His armies succeeded in slaying Emperor Sigismund and wiping the Imperial province of Solland off the map. Gorbad was a hulking Orc who rose to fame as the leader of the Ironclaw Tribe. It was he who first built the Iron Rock, the most redoubtable Orc fastness in the Old World. Yet conquering greenskin tribes was no real challenge for Gorbad and so he inevitably crossed into the human land of the Empire.

Lord.Name: Azhag The Slaughterer
Lord.Description: Azhag the Slaughterer is one of the most infamous Orcish Warlord in recent history. He has brought a trail of ruin and destruction to the northern lands of the Old World, laying waste to cities, fortresses and mountain strongholds wherever he goes. Atop his head lies the key to his power and uncommon intelligence in tactics and warfare -- an ominous iron crown which emanates an ancient evil long thought forgotten from history. It is from this crown, a relic of olden days, which granted Azhag sorcerous powers and gave him the vision he needed to command a Waaagh! of epic proportions.

Lord.Name: Grimgor Ironhide
Lord.Description: Grimgor Ironhide - is currently the single most violent Black Orc Warboss ever to exist. He leads tribes of vicious Orcs to lay waste all across the Old World.

Lord.Name: Grom The Paunch
Lord.Description: Warlord Grom, known more famously as Grom the Pauch or Grom the Fat of the Misty Mountains is not only the largest and most powerful Goblin ever known, but also among the greatest of Greenskin Warbosses, having even invaded the distant lands of Ulthuan in a rampage of violence and destruction. Gobbos are cowardly and disloyal, but nothing stirs their wicked hearts like Grom, mightiest of Goblin Warbosses. Stories of Grom's greatness still command attention around any Goblin camp and if a Shaman should conjure his superlative-sized image, even the most boisterous gobbo will behave with reverence. Grom is said to not have been killed, nor found after the battle. Taking up his infamous' Leutenant's Wyvern, fleeing the battlefield. Grom the Paunch is a reminder to all Goblins, a personification of something they will never be, yet always worship. In question to Games Workshop it is said that Grom's Waaagh was such size, that the very Empire shook for days and nights until they held at bay near Stirland, building hundreds of thousands of vassalized 'Ships', to move the force of millions of Greenskins, towards Ulthuan, making this Waaagh! The most infamous to records ever before and after.

Lord.Name: Skarsnik
Lord.Description: Skarsnik - is the chieftain of the Crooked Moon tribe and the most powerful Night Goblin Warlord in the whole of the World's Edge Mountain. Skarsnik is infamous amongst the greenskin race for his astonishing sneakiness and cunning in strategy and subterfuge.

HandWeapon.Name: Skarsnik's Prodder
HandWeapon.Rule: Bound spell Strength 5, hit Strength 6 with a range of 24"

Lord.Name: Orc Warboss
Lord.Description: Are the biggest, meanest, and most strongest Orc within a tribe, being both the supreme tyrant and a hulking behemoth that is considered by himself to be the greatest Greenskin warrior around. These powerful individuals are relatively cunning and exceedingly powerful warriors, having fought and pummelled his way through his tribe's hierarchy by winning battles and killing every challenger that would dare to defy his tyranny. Equipped with powerful weapons and armour, these brutish warriors are near unstoppable upon the battlefield.

HeavyArmour.Dependencies: On: Black Orc; Off: Light armour

Lord.Name: Orc Great Shaman
Lord.Description: These psychotic individuals are those few Orc Shamans within a tribe whom have managed to control and harness the spells of Da Big Waaagh! to a much greater effect. Great Shamans of the Orc tribes are amongst some of the most powerful spell-casters known to the greenskins, capable of everything from melting brains to summoning the great foot of the mighty Gork himself, in order to stamp out your foes.

Lord.Name: Goblin Warboss
Lord.Description: Are the biggest, cleverest, and most cunning Goblin within a tribe, whom are known to be an exceedingly crafty leader as well as a fairly adept strategist in both conventional and unconventional warfare. Instead of fighting their way into the top, most Goblins use a more subtle method to gain power, usually employing tactics such as assassination, backstabbing or poison to get the job done. As with any Warboss, these Goblins are often equipped with some of the finest weapons and armour within a tribe.

Lord.Name: Goblin Great Shaman
Lord.Description: Like their larger Orc cousins, these Goblin Shamans have also mastered the use of spell-casting to a much greater effect then those amateur Goblin whom often die by the droves due to their inability to channel the spells of Da Little Waaagh! without exploding. Night Goblin Great Shamans are especially powerful individuals, for they are also expert potion brewers as well as powerful spell-caster.

Hero.Name: Orc Big Boss
Hero.Description: These Orcs are often the leaders of a warband of Greenskin warriors, acting in a sense as a position of a sergeant or lieutenant to a Greenskin Warlord. Often times, these Big Bosses are also called Big Un's, Orcs whom have grown to an unnaturally large size, and are equipped with a horrific array of thick armour or powerful weapons.

BattleStandardBearer.Dependencies: Great weapon, Additional weapon, Spear, Shield

HeavyArmour.Dependencies: On: Black Orc; Off: Light armour

Hero.Name: Orc Shaman
Hero.Description: These psychotic individuals are those few Orc Shamans within a tribe whom have managed to control and harness the spells of Da Big Waaagh! to a much greater effect. Great Shamans of the Orc tribes are amongst some of the most powerful spell-casters known to the greenskins, capable of everything from melting brains to summoning the great foot of the mighty Gork himself, in order to stamp out your foes.

Hero.Name: Goblin Big Boss
Hero.Description: Orcs determine their hierarchy in a simple manner - the biggest and best fighter takes control. Goblins follow a less straightforward path to the top ranks, as they are both more devious and more cowardly than their brutish Orc cousins. Underhanded ploys and strategy are the preferred tactics for Goblins; although straight-up fighting is still an option, it is one that is typically left to the especially desperate. All Goblins use dirty tricks, with the best schemers being the most dangerous of their diminutive kind and the most likely to rise through the ranks. Those Goblins that make it to the very top are known as Big Bosses.

BattleStandardBearer.Dependencies: Great weapon, Additional weapon, Spear, Shield

Hero.Name: Goblin Shaman
Hero.Description: Like their larger Orc cousins, these Goblin Shamans have also mastered the use of spell-casting to a much greater effect then those amateur Goblin whom often die by the droves due to their inability to channel the spells of Da Little Waaagh! without exploding. Night Goblin Great Shamans are especially powerful individuals, for they are also expert potion brewers as well as powerful spell-caster.

Core.Name: Orc Boyz
Core.Description: These hard-fighting warriors form the backbone of all Greenskin armies, and often does the bulk of the fighting upon the battlefield. Orc Boyz are generally just simple Orcs who have taken up arms to fight the enemy of his tribe with nothing but ramshackle armour and crude weaponry.

Core.Name: Orc Arrer Boys
Core.Description: Though most Orcs prefer the use of close-combat weapons, some Orcs and Savage Orcs have been known to bring bows into combat. Though they are notoriously inaccurate in their shots, the ferocity of their volleys prove adequate enough that they are conceived as a threat.

Core.Name: Savage Orc Boys
Core.Description: Like all their kin, primitive tribes of Savage Orcs have been known to congregate alongside their peers and join in the carnage and plunder that is often rewarded upon joining a Waaagh! into battle. Equipped with nothing but tribal tattoos and crude weapons made of stone, bone or wood, these Orcs are nonetheless ferocious, if not unpredictable fighters.

Core.Name: Goblins
Core.Description: These scrawny cowards forms the overall bulk of many Greenskin armies but often do the least amount of fighting. Weak and cowardice by nature, these mediocre warriors bring with them primitive hunting spears, broken swords, crude bows, and wooden shields into combat. What they lack in quality, they make up for with quantity.

Core.Name: Goblin Wolf Riders
Core.Description: These Wolf Riders are the scourge of the open plains, where their swiftness and speed can outpace even the most determined Boar Boy within a matter of seconds. Equipped with either spears or composite bows, Wolf Rider serves as a dedicated force of scouts and skirmishers for many marauding Greenskin armies.

Core.Name: Forest Goblin Spider Riders
Core.Description: Forest Goblins are notorious for their worship of the Spiders of the forest, and it is this connection with them that has allowed the Goblins to ride them into battle. With the ability to crawl up steep slopes and spew their enemies with sticky webs, these war mounts are horrifying to all those that face them in a siege.

Core.Name: Night Goblins
Core.Description: Living within the fungus infested tunnels of the Old World, the Night Goblins are renown for their consumption of madness-inducing fungus that gives them both the courage to fight against foes that the average Goblin would be too afraid of facing. Equipped with a variety of weapons such as nets, crude spears, and composite bows, these Night Goblins are ferocious tunnel-fighters.

Core.Name: Snotlings
Core.Description: These small and dull-witted creatures are amongst the most mediocre of the Goblin race. Equipped with pathetic weapons such as tree branches, mushrooms or bits of bone, a horde of these little monsters are nothing more than a nuisance or a distraction to even the weakest enemies they face.

Special.Name: Black Orcs
Special.Description: These Orcs are amongst the biggest, meanest and most heavily-armoured of all Orcish warriors. Equipped with impossibly large and thick plates of black armour, and armed with weapons that can cleave a Knight in two, these warriors form the crack elite infantry of many Greenskin armies.

Special.Name: Orc Boar Boyz
Special.Description: Only the most daring of Orcs have the capability to mount the savage War Boar into battle, for the animals hot-temper often results in the deaths of many Orcs who tries to ride them. In battle, mobs of Boar Boys fulfil the role of heavy cavalry.

Special.Name: Savage Orc Boar Boys
Special.Description: Unlike Boar Boyz who subdue their mounts before riding them, the Savage Orcs have been known to ride these Boars whenever they are needed. In this instance, a Savage Orc would stalk a wild Boar, subdue it, and ride the beast into battle. This tactic often enrages the Boar into a berserk fury, making the charge of a Savage Orc Boar that more terrifying.

Special.Name: Orc Boar Chariot
Special.Description: By lashing together roughly hewn logs, the otherwise dull-witted Orcs have managed to create through sheer luck and determination, crude yet formidable war chariots. With the weight of both the two Boars and the chariot itself, this shock cavalry has the potential to break apart even the thickest of enemy formations so long as the chariot still holds together.

Special.Name: Night Goblic Squig Hoppers
Special.Description: These riders are simply just crazed Night Goblins who thought it interesting to leap upon the back of his Squig and ride it like a mount. Although the majority of Night Goblins that try these stunts end up being eaten, the ability for the Night Goblin Rider to direct these Squigs unto the enemy have proven so effective that the Night Goblin tribes have begun to field them against their enemies as their own form of light cavalry.
